<a href="https://kea.js.org/">https://kea.js.org/</a><div id="articleHeader"><h1>Kea</h1></div><div><div><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," /><div><strong>High level abstraction between <nobr>React and Redux</nobr></strong></div></div></div><h2>What is Kea?</h2><div><p>Kea is a state management library for React. It <em>empowers</em> Redux, making it as easy to use as <code>setState</code> while retaining composability and improving code clarity.</p><ul><li><strong>100% Redux</strong>: Built on top of <a href="http://redux.js.org/" target="_blank">redux</a> and <a href="https://github.com/reactjs/reselect" target="_blank">reselect</a>.</li><li><strong>Side effect agnostic</strong>: use <a href="/effects/thunk" target="_blank">thunks</a> with redux-thunk, <a href="/effects/saga" target="_blank">sagas</a> with redux-saga or (soon!) <a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea/issues/40" target="_blank">epics</a> with redux-observable.</li><li><strong>Wrappable</strong>: Write logic alongside React components. Easier than <code>setState</code> and perfect for small components.</li><li><strong>Connectable</strong>: Pull in data and actions through ES6+ <a href="/guide/connected" target="_blank">imports</a>. Built for large and ambitious apps.</li><li><strong>No boilerplate</strong>: Forget <code>mapStateToProps</code> and redundant constants. Only write code that matters!</li><li><strong>No new concepts</strong>: Use actions, reducers and selectors. Gradually migrate <a href="/guide/migration" target="_blank">existing Redux applications</a>.</li></ul><p>Compare it to other state management libraries: <a href="https://medium.com/@mariusandra/kea-vs-setstate-redux-mobx-dva-jumpstate-apollo-etc-4aa26ea11d02" target="_blank">Kea vs setState, Redux, Mobx, Dva, JumpState, Apollo, etc.</a></p></div><h2>Thank you to our sponsors!</h2><div><p><a href="https://opencollective.com/kea#sponsor" target="_blank">Support this project by becoming a sponsor</a>.</p><p>Your logo will show up here and in the <a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea" target="_blank">README</a> with a link to your website.</p></div><h2>How does it work?</h2><div><div><p>In Kea, you define logic stores with the <code>kea({})</code> function.</p><p>Each logic store contains <code>actions</code>, <code>reducers</code> and <code>selectors</code>.</p></div><div><pre><code>kea({
  actions: ({}) =&gt; ({ }),
  reducers: ({ actions }) =&gt; ({ }),
  selectors: ({ selectors }) =&gt; ({ })
})
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><p>They work just like in Redux:</p><ul><li>They are all pure functions (no side effects, same input = same output)</li><li><strong>Actions</strong> are functions which take an input and return a payload</li><li><strong>Reducers</strong> take actions as input and return new_data = old_data + payload</li><li><strong>Selectors</strong> take the input of multiple reducers and return a combined output</li></ul><p>See here for a nice overview of how Redux works: <a href="https://medium.com/gitconnected/redux-logic-flow-crazy-simple-summary-35416eadabd8" target="_blank">Redux Logic Flow — Crazy Simple Summary</a></p><p>For example, to build a simple counter:</p></div><div><pre><code>kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    increment: (amount) =&gt; ({ amount }),
    decrement: (amount) =&gt; ({ amount })
  }),

  reducers: ({ actions }) =&gt; ({
    counter: [0, PropTypes.number, {
      [actions.increment]: (state, payload) =&gt; state + payload.amount,
      [actions.decrement]: (state, payload) =&gt; state - payload.amount
    }]
  }),

  selectors: ({ selectors }) =&gt; ({
    doubleCounter: [
      () =&gt; [selectors.counter],
      (counter) =&gt; counter * 2,
      PropTypes.number
    ]
  })
})
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><p>The logic stores can either</p><p>1) be wrapped around your component or pure function:</p></div><div><pre><code>const logic = kea({ /* options from above */ })

class Counter extends Component {
  render () {
    const { counter, doubleCounter } = this.props
    const { increment, decrement } = this.actions

    return &lt;div&gt;...&lt;/div&gt;
  }
}

export default logic(Counter)
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><p>2) used as decorators:</p></div><div><pre><code>@kea({ /* options from above */ })
export default class Counter extends Component {
  render () {
    return &lt;div /&gt;
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><p>3) imported and then connected to.</p><p>You can also connect logic stores together, to e.g:</p><ul><li>... use actions from one logic store in the reducer of another.</li><li>... combine reducers from multiple logic stores into one selector.</li></ul></div><div><pre><code>// features-logic.js
import { kea } from 'kea'
export default kea({ /* options from above */ })

// index.js
import { connect } from 'kea'
import featuresLogic from 'features-logic'

@connect({
  actions: [
    featuresLogic, [
      'increment',
      'decrement'
    ]
  ],
  props: [
    featuresLogic, [
      'counter',
      'doubleCounter'
    ]
  ]
})
export default class Counter extends Component {
  render () {
    return &lt;div /&gt;
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><p>Eventually you'll need side effects. Then you have a choice.</p><p>You can use simple <a href="/effects/thunk" target="_blank">thunks</a> via redux-thunk:</p></div><div><pre><code>import 'kea-thunk'
import { kea } from 'kea'

const incrementerLogic = kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    increase: true
  }),
  reducers: ({ actions }) =&gt; ({
    counter: [0, PropTypes.number, {
      [actions.increase]: (state, payload) =&gt; state + 1
    }]
  }),
  thunks: ({ actions, dispatch, getState }) =&gt; ({
    increaseAsync: async (ms) =&gt; {
      await delay(ms)
      await actions.increase()
    }
  })
})
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><p>.... or the more powerful <a href="/effects/saga" target="_blank">sagas</a> via redux-saga.</p><p>(coming soon: <a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea/issues/40" target="_blank">support for epics</a> with redux-observable)</p><p>Check out the examples below or <a href="/guide/installation" target="_blank">start reading the guide</a> for more.</p><p>If you're already using Redux in your apps, it's <a href="/guide/migration" target="_blank">really easy to migrate</a>.</p></div><div><pre><code>import 'kea-saga'
import { kea } from 'kea'

const sliderLogic = kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    updateSlide: index =&gt; ({ index })
  }),

  reducers: ({ actions, key }) =&gt; ({
    currentSlide: [0, PropTypes.number, {
      [actions.updateSlide]: (state, payload) =&gt; payload.index % images.length
    }]
  }),

  selectors: ({ selectors }) =&gt; ({
    currentImage: [
      () =&gt; [selectors.currentSlide],
      (currentSlide) =&gt; images[currentSlide],
      PropTypes.object
    ]
  }),

  start: function * () {
    const { updateSlide } = this.actions

    while (true) {
      const { timeout } = yield race({
        change: take(updateSlide.toString()),
        timeout: delay(5000)
      })

      if (timeout) {
        const currentSlide = yield this.get('currentSlide')
        yield put(updateSlide(currentSlide + 1))
      }
    }
  }
})
</code></pre></div></div><h2>Simple counter</h2><div><div><div><pre><code>import React, { Component } from 'react'
import PropTypes from 'prop-types'
import { kea } from 'kea'

@kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    increment: (amount) =&gt; ({ amount }),
    decrement: (amount) =&gt; ({ amount })
  }),

  reducers: ({ actions }) =&gt; ({
    counter: [0, PropTypes.number, {
      [actions.increment]: (state, payload) =&gt; state + payload.amount,
      [actions.decrement]: (state, payload) =&gt; state - payload.amount
    }]
  }),

  selectors: ({ selectors }) =&gt; ({
    doubleCounter: [
      () =&gt; [selectors.counter],
      (counter) =&gt; counter * 2,
      PropTypes.number
    ]
  })
})
export default class Counter extends Component {
  render () {
    const { counter, doubleCounter } = this.props
    const { increment, decrement } = this.actions

    return (
      &lt;div className='kea-counter'&gt;
        Count: {counter}&lt;br /&gt;
        Doublecount: {doubleCounter}&lt;br /&gt;
        &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; increment(1)}&gt;Increment&lt;/button&gt;
        &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; decrement(1)}&gt;Decrement&lt;/button&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    )
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><div>Count: 0<br />Doublecount: 0</div></div>Read the guide: <a href="/guide/counter" target="_blank">Counter</a></div></div><h2>Delayed Counter <small>with <a href="/effects/thunk" target="_blank">thunks</a></small></h2><div><div><div><pre><code>import React, { Component } from 'react'
import { kea } from 'kea'
import PropTypes from 'prop-types'

const delay = ms =&gt; new Promise(resolve =&gt; window.setTimeout(resolve, ms))

@kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    increase: true
  }),
  reducers: ({ actions }) =&gt; ({
    counter: [0, PropTypes.number, {
      [actions.increase]: (state, payload) =&gt; state + 1
    }]
  }),
  thunks: ({ actions, dispatch, getState }) =&gt; ({
    increaseAsync: async (ms) =&gt; {
      await delay(ms)
      await actions.increase()
    }
  })
})
export default class ThunkCounter extends Component {
  render () {
    const { increase, increaseAsync } = this.actions
    const { counter } = this.props

    return (
      &lt;div style={{textAlign: 'center'}}&gt;
        &lt;div&gt;{counter}&lt;/div&gt;
        {[0, 10, 100, 500, 1000, 2000].map(ms =&gt; (
          &lt;button key={ms}
                  onClick={() =&gt; ms === 0 ? increase() : increaseAsync(ms)}&gt;
            {ms}
          &lt;/button&gt;
        ))}
      &lt;/div&gt;
    )
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div><div><p>Read the docs: <a href="/effects/thunk" target="_blank">kea-thunk</a></p><p>Play with it in <a href="https://www.webpackbin.com/bins/-KxSPoMw6q-_lcXY8guq" target="_blank">WebpackBin</a></p></div></div><h2>Slider <small>with <a href="/effects/saga" target="_blank">sagas</a></small></h2><div><div><div><pre><code>import React, { Component } from 'react'
import PropTypes from 'prop-types'
import { kea } from 'kea'

import { take, race, put } from 'redux-saga/effects'

import delay from '~/utils/delay' // promise-based timeout helper
import range from '~/utils/range' // range(3) === [0, 1, 2]

import images from './images'     // array of objects [{ src, author }, ...]

@kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    updateSlide: index =&gt; ({ index })
  }),

  reducers: ({ actions, key }) =&gt; ({
    currentSlide: [0, PropTypes.number, {
      [actions.updateSlide]: (state, payload) =&gt; payload.index % images.length
    }]
  }),

  selectors: ({ selectors }) =&gt; ({
    currentImage: [
      () =&gt; [selectors.currentSlide],
      (currentSlide) =&gt; images[currentSlide],
      PropTypes.object
    ]
  }),

  start: function * () {
    const { updateSlide } = this.actions

    while (true) {
      const { timeout } = yield race({
        change: take(updateSlide.toString()),
        timeout: delay(5000)
      })

      if (timeout) {
        const currentSlide = yield this.get('currentSlide')
        yield put(updateSlide(currentSlide + 1))
      }
    }
  }
})
export default class Slider extends Component {
  render () {
    const { currentSlide, currentImage } = this.props
    const { updateSlide } = this.actions

    const title = `Image copyright by ${currentImage.author}`

    return (
      &lt;div className='kea-slider'&gt;
        &lt;img src={currentImage.src} alt={title} title={title} /&gt;
        &lt;div className='buttons'&gt;
          {range(images.length).map(i =&gt; (
            &lt;span key={i}
                  className={i === currentSlide ? 'selected' : ''}
                  onClick={() =&gt; updateSlide(i)} /&gt;
          ))}
        &lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    )
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><div><div class="readableLargeImageContainer"><img src="/a63cfb870de9e2d5a64f396ede8c30b0.jpg" alt="Image copyright by Geof Wilson" title="Image copyright by Geof Wilson" /></div></div></div>Read the guide: <a href="/guide/sliders" target="_blank">Sliders</a></div></div><h2>Github <small>with <a href="/effects/saga" target="_blank">sagas</a></small></h2><div><div><div><pre><code>import React, { Component } from 'react'
import PropTypes from 'prop-types'
import { kea } from 'kea'

import { put, call } from 'redux-saga/effects'
import { delay } from 'redux-saga'

const API_URL = 'https://api.github.com'

@kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    setUsername: (username) =&gt; ({ username }),
    setRepositories: (repositories) =&gt; ({ repositories }),
    setFetchError: (message) =&gt; ({ message })
  }),

  reducers: ({ actions }) =&gt; ({
    username: ['keajs', PropTypes.string, {
      [actions.setUsername]: (_, payload) =&gt; payload.username
    }],
    repositories: [[], PropTypes.array, {
      [actions.setUsername]: () =&gt; [],
      [actions.setRepositories]: (_, payload) =&gt; payload.repositories
    }],
    isLoading: [true, PropTypes.bool, {
      [actions.setUsername]: () =&gt; true,
      [actions.setRepositories]: () =&gt; false,
      [actions.setFetchError]: () =&gt; false
    }],
    error: [null, PropTypes.string, {
      [actions.setUsername]: () =&gt; null,
      [actions.setFetchError]: (_, payload) =&gt; payload.message
    }]
  }),

  selectors: ({ selectors }) =&gt; ({
    sortedRepositories: [
      () =&gt; [selectors.repositories],
      (repositories) =&gt; repositories.sort(
                          (a, b) =&gt; b.stargazers_count - a.stargazers_count),
      PropTypes.array
    ]
  }),

  start: function * () {
    const { setUsername } = this.actions
    const username = yield this.get('username')
    yield put(setUsername(username))
  },

  takeLatest: ({ actions, workers }) =&gt; ({
    [actions.setUsername]: workers.fetchRepositories
  }),

  workers: {
    * fetchRepositories (action) {
      const { setRepositories, setFetchError } = this.actions
      const { username } = action.payload

      yield delay(100) // debounce for 100ms

      const url = `${API_URL}/users/${username}/repos?per_page=250`
      const response = yield window.fetch(url)

      if (response.status === 200) {
        const json = yield response.json()
        yield put(setRepositories(json))
      } else {
        const json = yield response.json()
        yield put(setFetchError(json.message))
      }
    }
  }
})
export default class Github extends Component {
  render () {
    const { username, isLoading, repositories,
            sortedRepositories, error } = this.props
    const { setUsername } = this.actions

    return (
      &lt;div className='example-github-scene'&gt;
        &lt;div style={{marginBottom: 20}}&gt;
          &lt;h1&gt;Search for a github user&lt;/h1&gt;
          &lt;input value={username}
                 type='text'
                 onChange={e =&gt; setUsername(e.target.value)} /&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;
        {isLoading ? (
          &lt;div&gt;
            Loading...
          &lt;/div&gt;
        ) : repositories.length &gt; 0 ? (
          &lt;div&gt;
            Found {repositories.length} repositories for user {username}!
            {sortedRepositories.map(repo =&gt; (
              &lt;div key={repo.id}&gt;
                &lt;a href={repo.html_url} target='_blank'&gt;{repo.full_name}&lt;/a&gt;
                {' - '}{repo.stargazers_count} stars, {repo.forks} forks.
              &lt;/div&gt;
            ))}
          &lt;/div&gt;
        ) : (
          &lt;div&gt;
            {error ? `Error: ${error}` : 'No repositories found'}
          &lt;/div&gt;
        )}
      &lt;/div&gt;
    )
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><div><div><h1>Search for a github user</h1></div><div>Found 11 repositories for user keajs!<div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea" target="_blank">keajs/kea</a> - 1297 stars, 45 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-website" target="_blank">keajs/kea-website</a> - 7 stars, 7 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-on-rails" target="_blank">keajs/kea-on-rails</a> - 5 stars, 0 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-example" target="_blank">keajs/kea-example</a> - 4 stars, 1 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-localstorage" target="_blank">keajs/kea-localstorage</a> - 2 stars, 0 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-saga" target="_blank">keajs/kea-saga</a> - 2 stars, 3 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-parallel" target="_blank">keajs/kea-parallel</a> - 2 stars, 0 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-cli" target="_blank">keajs/kea-cli</a> - 1 stars, 1 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-parallel-loader" target="_blank">keajs/kea-parallel-loader</a> - 0 stars, 0 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-rails-loader" target="_blank">keajs/kea-rails-loader</a> - 0 stars, 0 forks.</div><div><a href="https://github.com/keajs/kea-thunk" target="_blank">keajs/kea-thunk</a> - 0 stars, 3 forks.</div></div></div></div>Read the guide: <a href="/guide/github" target="_blank">Github</a></div></div><h2>Debounced countdown <small>with <a href="/effects/saga" target="_blank">sagas</a></small></h2><div><div><div><pre><code>import React, { Component } from 'react'
import PropTypes from 'prop-types'
import { kea } from 'kea'

import delay from '~/utils/delay'
import { put, cancelled } from 'redux-saga/effects'

@kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    start: true,
    finish: true,
    setCounter: (counter) =&gt; ({ counter })
  }),

  reducers: ({ actions, key, props }) =&gt; ({
    counter: [0, PropTypes.number, {
      [actions.setCounter]: (_, payload) =&gt; payload.counter
    }],
    finished: [false, PropTypes.bool, {
      [actions.start]: () =&gt; false,
      [actions.finish]: () =&gt; true
    }]
  }),

  takeLatest: ({ actions, workers }) =&gt; ({
    [actions.start]: function * () {
      try {
        const { setCounter, finish } = this.actions

        for (let i = 50; i &gt;= 0; i--) {
          yield put(setCounter(i))
          yield delay(50)
        }
        yield put(finish())
      } finally {
        if (yield cancelled()) {
          console.log('Countdown was cancelled!')
        }
      }
    }
  })
})
export default class Countdown extends Component {
  render () {
    const { counter, finished } = this.props
    const { start } = this.actions

    return (
      &lt;div className='kea-counter'&gt;
        Count: {counter}
        &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;
        {finished
          ? 'We made it until the end! finish() action triggered'
          : 'Click start to trigger the finish() action in a few seconds'}
        &lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;
        &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; start()}&gt;Start&lt;/button&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    )
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><div>Count: 0<br /><br />Click start to trigger the finish() action in a few seconds</div></div></div></div><h2>Connected logic stores</h2><div><div><div><pre><code>// features-logic.js
import PropTypes from 'prop-types'
import { kea } from 'kea'

export default kea({
  actions: () =&gt; ({
    toggleFeature: (feature) =&gt; ({ feature })
  }),
  reducers: ({ actions }) =&gt; ({
    features: [{}, PropTypes.object, {
      [actions.toggleFeature]: (state, payload) =&gt; {
        const { feature } = payload
        return {
          ...state,
          [feature]: !state[feature]
        }
      }
    }]
  })
})

// index.js
import React, { Component } from 'react'
import { connect } from 'kea'

import featuresLogic from '../features-logic'

@connect({
  actions: [
    featuresLogic, [
      'toggleFeature'
    ]
  ],
  props: [
    featuresLogic, [
      'features'
    ]
  ]
})
export default class ConnectedToggle extends Component {
  render () {
    const { features } = this.props
    const { toggleFeature } = this.actions

    return (
      &lt;div&gt;
        &lt;p&gt;{features.something ? 'Something enabled' : 'Something disabled'}&lt;/p&gt;
        &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; toggleFeature('something')}&gt;Toggle something&lt;/button&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    )
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div><div><div><div><p>Something disabled</p></div></div>Read the guide: <a href="/guide/connected" target="_blank">Connected</a></div></div>
